Trait description: The shape of the pigment pattern which surrounds the hilum. The front of the hilum is the non-micropylar end.
Method description: Use of diagram illustrating eye pattern (IITA Genetic Resource Center)
Category 3: 2 =‚Kabba group (Eye fills the narrow groove all around the hilum, and the body has some form of speckling. A blue halo is also found around the hilum) (K)
Category 4: 3= ‚Narrow eye (Hilum Ring. Eye fills the narrow groove around the hilum and spills out of this groove in front of the hilum for a short distance and has an indistinct front margin) (N)
Category 5: 4= ‚Small eye (eye has a distinct margin, but is E smaller than Holstein group)
Category 6: 5= ‚Holstein group (eye encircles the back of the hilum in a narrow ring, widens at the sides,and then extends margin of the eye is very distinct) (H)
Category 7: 6 =‚Watson group (eye encircles the back of the hilum as a narrow ring, widens at the sides and spills over the non micropylar end of the seed withan indistinct margin. The extra width at the sidesof the hilum distinguishes this group from 3, narrow eye) (W)

Category 3: 3=slight yellowing of the midrib - no cupping
Category 5: 5=pronounced yellowing at midrib and side veins - yellowing extends slightly between the veins - symptoms may or may not be associated with moderate cupping
Category 7: 7= severe yellowing of the leaves followed by drying of leaf tips and leaf margins - characteristic hopper burn" observed"
Category 9: 9=severe defoliation, followed by wilting, resulting in death of plants

Trait description: Flower thrip damage to stipules, flower buds and peduncles
Method description: Visual rating based on a combination of varying intensities of browning of the stipules and flower buds, non-elongation of peducles, and flower bud abscission
Category 1: 1=no browning/drying (i.e. scaling) of stipules, leaf or flower buds - no bud abscission
Category 3: 3= initiation of browning of stipules, leaf or flower buds - no bud abscission
Category 5: 5=distinct browning/drying of stipules and leaf or flower buds - some bud abscission
Category 7: 7=serious bud abscission accompanied by browning/drying of stipules and buds - non-elongation of peduncles
Category 9: 9=very severe bud abscission, heavy browning/drying of stipules and buds - distinct non-elongation of (most or all) peduncles
